enum.name: Assigns bits 0 5 for SC specific use
no interworking, but SME to SME protocol
implicit device type is specific to this SC,
enum.comment: or can be concluded on the basis of the address

enum.name: telex (or teletex reduced to telex format)
National Paging system (known to the SC)
a message handling facility (known to the SC)
any public X.400 based message handling system
values specific to each SC,
enum.comment: usage based on mutual agreement between the SME and the SC (7 combinations available for each SC)

enum.name: A GSM mobile station.
enum.comment: The SC converts the SM from the received TP Data Coding Scheme to any data coding scheme supported by that MS (e.g. the default).

element.name: TP-DCS
element.comment: Parameter identifying the coding scheme within the TP User Data.

enum.name: Message Marked for Automatic Deletion Group
the text is compressed using the GSM standard
enum.comment: the text is compressed using the GSM standard compression algorithm. ( see GSM TS 03.42)

enum.name: bits 1 to 0 are reserved and have no message class meaning
bits 1 to 0 have a message class meaning

field.name: TP-UDL
field.description: number of characters in the SMS

element.name: TP-SCTS
element.comment: Parameter identifying time when the SC received the message.

element.name: TP-PI
element.comment: Parameter indicating the presence of any of the optional parameters which follow.

field.name: TP-RP
field.comment: Parameter indicating that Reply Path exists.

enum.name: TP Reply Path parameter is not set in this SMS SUBMIT/DELIVER
TP Reply Path parameter is set in this SMS SUBMIT/DELIVER

field.name: TP-UDHI
field.comment: Parameter indicating that the TP UD field contains a Header.

enum.name: The TP UD field contains only the short message
The beginning of the TP UD field contains a Header in addition to the short message

field.name: TP-SRR
field.comment: Parameter indicating if the MS is requesting a status report.

enum.name: A status report is not requested

field.name: TP-VPF
field.comment: Parameter indicating whether or not the TP VP field is present.

enum.name: TP VP field present - relative format
TP VP field present - absolute format

field.name: TP-RD
field.comment: Parameter indicating whether or not the SC shall accept an SMS SUBMIT for an SM still held in the SC which has the same TP MR and the same TP DA as a previously submitted SM from the same OA.

enum.name: Instruct the SC to accept duplicates
enum.comment: Instruct the SC to accept an SMS SUBMIT for an SM still held in the SC which has the same TP MR and the same TP DA as a previously submitted SM from the same OA.

enum.name: Instruct the SC to reject duplicates
enum.comment: Instruct the SC to reject an SMS SUBMIT for an SM still held in the SC which has the same TP MR and the same TP DA as the previously submitted SM from the same OA. In this case an appropriate TP FCS value will be returned in the SMS SUBMIT REPORT.

field.name: TP-MTI
field.comment: Parameter describing the message type.

field.comment: Not used.

field.comment: Parameter indicating that SMS applications should inhibit forwarding or automatic message generation that could cause infinite looping.

enum.name: The message has not been forwarded and is not a spawned message
enum.comment: (or the sending network entity (e.g. an SC) does not support the setting of this bit.)

enum.name: The message has either been forwarded or is a spawned message

field.comment: Parameter indicating whether or not there are more messages to send.

ITU-T standardized coding, as described below
Standard specific to identified location (see Note)
private network serving the local user (LPN)
public network serving the local user (LN)
public network serving the remote user (RLN)
private network serving the remote user (RPN)
Class 000 normal event : No route to specified transit network
Class 000 normal event : No route to destination
Class 000 normal event : Send special information tone ISUP
Class 000 normal event : Misdialled trunk prefix
Class 000 normal event : Call awarded and being delivered in an established channel
Class 000 normal event : Preemption - circuit reserved for reuse
Class 001 normal event : Normal call clearing
Class 001 normal event : No user responding
Class 001 normal event : No answer from user (user alerted)
Class 001 normal event : Redirection to new destination
Class 001 normal event : Exchange routing error
Class 001 normal event : Non-selected user clearing
Class 001 normal event : Destination out of order
Class 001 normal event : Invalid number format (address incomplete)
Class 001 normal event : Response to STATUS ENQUIRY
Class 010 resource unavailable : No circuit/channel available
Class 010 resource unavailable : Network out of order
Class 010 resource unavailable : Permanent frame mode connection out of service
Class 010 resource unavailable : Permanent frame mode connection operational
Class 010 resource unavailable : Switching equipment congestion
Class 010 resource unavailable: Access information discarded
Class 010 resource unavailable : Requested circuit/channel not available
Class 010 resource unavailable : Precedence call blocked
Class 010 resource unavailable : Resource unavailable, unspecified
Class 011 service or option not available : Quality of service not available
Class 011 service or option not available : Requested facility not subscribed
Class 011 service or option not available : Outgoing calls barred within CUG
Class 011 service or option not available : Incoming calls barred within CUG
Class 011 service or option not available : Bearer capability not authorized
Class 011 service or option not available : Bearer capability not presently available
Class 011 service or option not available : Inconsistency in designated outgoing access information and subscriber class
Class 011 service or option not available : Service or option not available, unspecified
Class 100 service or option not implemented : Bearer capability not implemented
Class 100 service or option not implemented : Channel type not implemented
Class 100 service or option not implemented : Requested facility not implemented
Class 100 service or option not implemented : Only restricted digital information bearer capability is available
Class 100 service or option not implemented : Service or option not implemented, unspecified
Class 101 invalid message : Invalid call reference value
Class 101 invalid message : Identified channel does not exist
Class 101 invalid message : A suspended call exists, but this call identity does not
Class 101 invalid message : Call identity in use
Class 101 invalid message : No call suspended
Class 101 invalid message : Call having the requested call identity has been cleared
Class 101 invalid message : User not member of CUG
Class 101 invalid message : Incompatible destination
enum.description: b101 1000 Incompatible parameter (DSS 1) User-to-user indicators parameter name

enum.name: Class 101 invalid message : Invalid transit network selection
Class 101 invalid message : Invalid message, unspecified
Class 110 protocol error : Mandatory information element is missing
Class 110 protocol error : Message type non-existent or not implemented
Class 110 protocol error : Message not compatible with call state or message type non-existent or not implemented
Class 110 protocol error : Information element /parameter nonexistent or not implemented
enum.description: b110 0011 Information element identifier(s) (DSS 1) (Note 4 and Note 5)/Parameter names

enum.name: Class 110 protocol error : Invalid information element contents
Class 110 protocol error : Message not compatible with call state
Class 110 protocol error : Recovery on timer expiry
Class 110 protocol error : Parameter non-existent or not implemented, passed on
Class 110 protocol error : Message with unrecognized parameter, discarded
Class 110 protocol error : Protocol error, unspecified
ITU-T standardized coding as described below
Standard defined for the network (either public or private) present on the network side of the interface
ITU-T standardized rate adaption V.110, I.460 and X.30
enum.description: b00001 This implies the presence of octet 5a and optionally octets 5b, 5c and 5d as defined below

enum.name: Recommendation G.721 [11] 32 kbit/s ADPCM and Recommendation I.460
Non-ITU-T standardized rate adaption
enum.description: b00111 This implies the presence of octet 5a and, optionally, octets 5b, 5c and 5d. The use of this codepoint indicates that the user rate specified in octet 5a is defined by the user. Addition ally, octets 5b, 5c and 5d, if present, are defined in accordance with the user specified rate adaption

enum.name: ITU-T standardized rate adaption V.120
enum.description: b01000 This implies the presence of octets 5a and 5b as defined below, and optionally octets 5c and 5d

enum.name: ITU-T standardized rate adaption X.31 HDLC flag stuffing

field.name: date
field.description: Date in the format [YYYYMMDD] where YYYY=years MM=months DD=days

field.name: time
field.description: Time in the format [hhmmss] where hh=hours mm=minuts ss=seconds

field.name: timezone
field.description: Timezone in the format [ZZ] where ZZ=hours
